sentence.Network_en: She belted out ballads and hillbilly songs one after another all evening.
sentence.Network_cn: 她整晚一个接一个地大唱民谣和乡村小调.

sentence.Network_en: A hillbilly walked down the street near the draft board.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一个乡下人在距兵役局不远的一条街上走着.

sentence.Network_en: A hillbilly love song was on the jukebox.
sentence.Network_cn: 自动唱机正在放一张乡间情歌唱片.

list.abs: 豪门新人类（Beverly Hillbillies），情景喜剧，从1962 开播至1971。hillbillies指美国东南部山区的农民，乡下人的意思。
猫王（the hillbilly cat）埃尔维斯·普雷斯利--“猫王（the hillbilly cat）”(The Hillbilly Cat)，这个绰号是狂热的美国南方歌迷为他取的昵称。
摇滚之王猫王（The Hillbilly Cat）埃尔威斯·普莱斯利（Elvis Aron Presley）与凯迪拉克（Cadillac）至今都是美国文化的重要标识。
托福常用词组 - 豆丁网 ... higher education 高等教育 hillbilly music 乡村音乐 hired hand 雇员.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from hill + Billy (pet form of the given name William)

entry.def: If you refer to someone as a hillbilly, you are saying in a fairly rude way that you think they are uneducated and stupid because they come from the countryside.

means.word_mean: 1. a disparaging term for an unsophisticated person
